TopicTitle: From Dawn to Dusk - One Year Kopernicus Challenge

Articles.Content:
I got inspired by a few things. 

Gameslinx, a bucket of rocks, and TWG's Arkas development.

I've thus decided that I would like to learn and experiment with Kopernicus every day (i can) for 365 days, starting August 11th, 2021.
My goal is simple. Make a planet pack that's enjoyable and way over the top, that's compatible with some other big names, *cough cough* OPM *cough cough* and overall just a fun learning experience.

For the first few days before the challenge begins, I'm going to try to expand my small brain to fit the universe of Kopernicus inside of it and teach myself the basics so I can make something neat. Any help would be appreciated.

Day One; My Birthday:
I kicked off this self-proclaimed-challenge with a bang, (or maybe a boom?) Huge thanks to TheWhiteGuardian for helping me along thusfar, I probably bore him to death. After over two hours, plenty of help, and trying to figure out how to convert files from .txt to .cfg, I successfully Created DAWN! the center of my new system. Until I get a home planet made, Dawn will be orbiting Kerbol at a really safe distance (so I don't have to look at it unless I want to)
I also started work on a small planet named Prova.

Day Two:

Today was very busy, with school and some exercise. I had very little time to work on anything today. I started on a gas giant (~7x Jool's size) that will be white with gold accents running through it (and maybe a thin, highly inclined ring from a munar collision)
I'm only about halfway done with the config file of it. Maybe I can finish it tomorrow. 

Edited August 13, 2021 by R3dst0ne_Warri0r

Anyways, this thread seems really promising! Getting the motivation to do something daily is certainly a trial, and I look forward to your future progress!
